Kiyosaki
Hill DiMarco the list goes on so if you

Dad you have to know these two words
assets and liabilities now forget what
you might have learned in your
accounting classes we're going to define
them in very simple terms an asset is
anything that puts money in your pocket
a liability is anything that takes money
from your pocket
anything can be an asset or a liability
if you own a house and it eats $1,000 a
month then it's a liability if you own a
house and it brings in $1,000 a month
then it's an asset assets are things
like businesses real estate paper assets
things like stocks and bonds here's why
knowing this distinction is so important
really try to focus on this the poor
only have expenses the rich buy assets
and the middle class by liabilities that
they think are assets after graduating
if I had followed everybody's advice I
would have gotten a job which increases
my income but there are so many problems
with that as I got my job my girlfriend
and I would have moved into a bigger
house we would have gotten a BMW in

acquiring assets while I was actually
acquiring liabilities I would have to
pay every month for the house for the
car for my expensive phone in essence
unless you make a paradigm shift about
what you do with your money which is to
buy actual assets no matter how much
income you earn from your job you will
just match it with your liabilities and

that is the problem so keep your job but
